definition: a white steed flits past a crack (idiom); How time flies!

white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

sentences.english: It is said that time is fleeting, it passes like this.
sentences.chinese: 是說時間如白駒過隙，逝者如斯。

sentences.english: The world is like a fleeting show.
Time, such as fleeting, but also have a ten flows from our side.
sentences.chinese: 時光如白駒過隙，又要有一個十年從我們身邊流過。

sentences.english: Time such as in a split second, the very fast quick royal concubine's funeral once expects.
sentences.chinese: 時間如白駒過隙，很快敏妃的喪期過了。

definition: the shrike and the swallow fly in different directions (idiom)/(usually of a couple) to part from each other
lit. a white cloud transforms into what looks like a gray dog (idiom)/fig. the unpredictable changeability of the world
(of time) to pass quickly/to be fleeting
lit. a dream of Nanke/fig. dreams of grandeur
to bid farewell/to part (usually with little hope of meeting again)
words still ringing in one's ears (idiom)
